WRITING.TITLE: Is it normal to be offered Student Prime after my Student Prime account had expired?
WRITING.TEXT:
I posted about my Student Prime account ending last Friday night (I'm the Mass Effect guy), and it ended as scheduled on the 22nd.
I saw that they were offering me Student Prime again that day, but I thought it was a mistake. Still, I was curious. So today I thought, "What the hell?" I clicked the button, and it appears I'm on track for another 4 years of Student Prime.
So I was wondering if this was a mistake or something that happens on a regular basis.
-and their new long running show begins.

WRITING.TITLE: Cancelling Prime subscription... Will my pre-order of Mass Effect Andromeda be eligible for Prime Savings?
WRITING.TEXT:
My Prime subscription is set to renew on the 20th of this month, the day before the game is released.
I want to cancel it because I really don't want to fork over $99 this month.
Typically, games I've POed have shipped the day before they're released, and I'd get them release day.
The Prime Savings is basically the only reason I'm not going to a brick and mortar store to by my games. So if Prime Savings won't be honored I'm just gonna cancel it and head to Best Buy or Target Tuesday morning.
So basically, I'm just wondering if my pre-order of Mass Effect Andromeda be eligible for Prime Savings after cancelling my Prime subscription?
People are acting as if Mass Effect never had weird, stilted animations. Honestly, this just looks par for the course to me.
